DOC.brief_summary: Objective : A randomized clinical trial order evaluate efficacy specific exercise strategy patient subacromial pain . Hypothesis : H1 - The three month specific exercise strategy satisfactory effect improve shoulder function and/or shoulder pain . H0 - No difference two exercise strategy ( specific exercise strategy active control exercise ) . Method : Patients attend primary care subacromial pain offer participation . If accept , participate three month rehabilitation program . The duration symptom vary 2 week longer . The patient randomize either rehabilitation ; specific exercise strategy active control exercise . All patient equal number session physical therapist ( PT ) offer similar attention support exercise performance . A blinded physical therapist evaluate follow outcome baseline three- , six twelve month : Primary outcome : Constant-Murley shoulder assessment ( CM-score ) . Secondary outcome ; Disabilities Arm Shoulder Hand questionnaire ( DASH ) , different aspect pain Visual Analogue Scale ( VAS ) , EuroQol-5D index ( EQ-5D ) EuroQol-VAS ( EQ-VAS ) , The Patient Specific functional Scale , Patients ' global impression change ( PGIC ) . Also sick-leave return work record . All patient evaluate diagnostic ultrasound reveal status rotator cuff . Additional analysis treatment effect shoulder function pain , factor influence explain CM-score follow-up analyze . This study warrant order evaluate earlier report positive effect shoulder function pain specific exercise strategy , patient wait list subacromial decompression , repeat primary care population patient subacromial pain . There consensus first-line exercise patient subacromial pain , positive result pain shoulder function need reproduce primary care recommend implement . Further , knowledge factor use prediction rule patient respond exercise need surgery lacking .
DOC.brief_title: SWESS : The SWedish Exercise Shoulder Study Primary Care Patients With Subacromial Pain
